metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Policies for information security - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SP 800-53 has comprehensive policy controls for all families. ISO 27002 guidance on topic-specific policies, management approval, and regular review all addressed via -1 family controls.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 provides specific guidance on policy structure, review triggers, and communication channels. SP 800-53 policy controls are less prescriptive about policy document structure.

clauses.title: Information security roles and responsibilities - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PM-02 assigns CISO/senior role. PS-01/PS-02 cover position risk designation and description. ISO 27002 guidance on role definition well addressed.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides specific implementation guidance on asset owner responsibilities. SP 800-53 addresses through system owner concept in PL-02 but 'asset owner' role less defined.

clauses.title: Segregation of duties - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AC-05 directly addresses separation of duties with specific implementation requirements.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 provides detailed guidance on identifying conflicting duties and compensating controls. AC-05 is comprehensive but less implementation-specific.

clauses.title: Management responsibilities - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PM-02 and PM-13 address management roles. PS-07 third-party personnel. AT-01 training policy.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides detailed guidance on management requiring compliance, providing resources, and leading by example. SP 800-53 less explicit on management behavioral expectations.

clauses.title: Contact with authorities - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IR-06 incident reporting to authorities; PM-15 security contacts. Implementation of authority relationships covered.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides guidance on maintaining authority contacts proactively for prevention, not just incident reporting.

clauses.title: Contact with special interest groups - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PM-15 directly covers contacts with security groups. PM-16 threat awareness. Implementation guidance aligned.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 details benefits including improved knowledge, early warnings, and advisory access.

clauses.title: Threat intelligence - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PM-16 threat awareness; RA-03 risk assessment; RA-05 vulnerability scanning; SI-05 security alerts; RA-10 threat hunting. Comprehensive threat intelligence implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 Rev 5 added strong threat intelligence capabilities.

clauses.title: Information security in project management - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-03 SDLC integration; SA-04 acquisition requirements; SA-08 security engineering; PM-07 enterprise architecture.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 specifies security integration into all project types (IT and non-IT). SP 800-53 SA controls focus on IT system development specifically.

clauses.title: Inventory of information and other associated assets - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CM-08 component inventory with automated mechanisms; PM-05 system inventory. Implementation guidance for inventory management well covered.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 distinguishes between information assets and supporting assets (hardware, software, cloud services, people, sites). SP 800-53 focuses on system components.

clauses.title: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PL-04 rules of behavior; AC-20 external system use; MP-07 media use. Acceptable use implementation covered.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 specifies 'return of assets' as part of acceptable use lifecycle. SP 800-53 separates this into PS-04.

clauses.title: Return of assets - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PS-04 personnel termination (return of assets); PS-05 personnel transfer. Implementation guidance aligned.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Classification of information - Implementation
clauses.rationale: RA-02 security categorization; AC-16 security/privacy attributes. Classification implementation covered through FIPS 199 framework.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides guidance on classification schemes, labeling, and handling procedures per classification. SP 800-53 uses categorization (C/I/A impact levels) which differs from typical ISO classification tiers.

clauses.title: Labelling of information - Implementation
clauses.rationale: MP-03 media marking; AC-16 security attributes. Labeling implementation partially covered.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 requires labeling procedures for all information formats (physical, electronic, verbal). SP 800-53 focuses on media marking.

clauses.title: Information transfer - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SC-07/SC-08 boundary and transmission protection; AC-04 information flow; AC-17 remote access; MP-05 media transport. Comprehensive transfer controls.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 includes transfer agreements and procedures for all forms (electronic, physical, verbal). SP 800-53 focuses on electronic/physical transfer; verbal transfer procedures are a gap.

clauses.title: Access control - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AC family is exceptionally comprehensive for access control implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Identity management - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IA family comprehensively covers identity management implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Authentication information - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IA-05 authenticator management with detailed implementation; IA-06 feedback; IA-07 cryptographic module authentication.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Access rights - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AC-02 account management with lifecycle controls; AC-06 least privilege; AC-02(3) disable inactive; AC-02(4) automated auditing.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Information security in supplier relationships - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-04 acquisition; SA-09 external services; SR family supply chain. Implementation guidance comprehensive.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 includes specific guidance on supplier information security policy and register. SP 800-53 distributes these across multiple controls.

clauses.title: Addressing information security within supplier agreements - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-04 covers specific security requirements in agreements. SA-09 addresses external service agreements.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 provides detailed agreement clause guidance. SA-04 enhancements partially cover this.

clauses.title: Managing information security in the ICT supply chain - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SR family comprehensively addresses ICT supply chain implementation including provenance, inspection, and testing.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Monitoring and review of supplier services - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-09(2) function/port identification; SR-06 supplier assessments; CA-07 continuous monitoring.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides specific guidance on supplier service monitoring, change management, and incident handling. Regular service review processes less explicit in SP 800-53.

clauses.title: Information security for use of cloud services - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-09 external services covers cloud conceptually. SA-04 acquisition. SC-07 boundary.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides specific cloud security implementation guidance (shared responsibility, exit, multi-tenancy). SP 800-53 doesn't have cloud-specific implementation controls; FedRAMP supplements this.

clauses.title: Incident management planning - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IR family comprehensively covers incident management implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Assessment and decision on information security events - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IR-04/IR-05 event assessment and monitoring. SI-04 system monitoring supports event identification.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Response to information security incidents - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IR-04 comprehensive incident handling including containment, eradication, and recovery.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Learning from information security incidents - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IR-03 incident response testing includes lessons learned. IR-04(8) correlation with threat intelligence.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 emphasizes structured knowledge management from incidents. SP 800-53 supports this but knowledge base concept less formalized.

clauses.title: Collection of evidence - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IR-04 incident handling includes evidence; AU family covers audit trail integrity. AU-09 protection of audit information.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 provides specific evidence handling guidance (chain of custody, admissibility). SP 800-53 less explicit on forensic evidence management procedures.

clauses.title: Information security during disruption - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CP family comprehensive for continuity implementation including planning, testing, recovery.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: ICT readiness for business continuity - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CP-02 contingency plan; CP-04 testing; CP-07 alternate site; CP-09 backup; CP-10 recovery.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 specifically addresses BIA for ICT services. SP 800-53 CP-02 requires BIA but ICT readiness analysis as a distinct concept is less explicit.

clauses.title: Legal requirements - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PL-04 rules include legal compliance; PM-01 program plan addresses legal; SA-04 contractual requirements.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides detailed guidance on identifying and documenting legal/regulatory/contractual requirements. SP 800-53 lacks a dedicated legal compliance identification implementation guide.

clauses.title: Intellectual property rights - Implementation
clauses.rationale: No direct SP 800-53 control.
clauses.gaps: Significant gap. SP 800-53 doesn't address software licensing, copyright, or IP protection implementation.

clauses.title: Protection of records - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AU-11 audit retention; SI-12 information management; AU-09 protection of audit information.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides records management implementation guidance (classification, retention schedules, destruction). SP 800-53 focuses on audit records rather than general records management.

clauses.title: Privacy and protection of PII - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PT family and PM privacy controls provide comprehensive PII protection implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 defers to ISO 27701. SP 800-53 privacy controls are comprehensive but focused on US federal context.

clauses.title: Independent review - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CA-02 security assessments with independent assessor option. CA-02(1) independent assessors.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 specifies independent review scope (approach, implementation, effectiveness). SP 800-53 assessments are comprehensive but review of ISMS approach specifically less explicit.

clauses.title: Compliance with policies - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CA-02 compliance assessment; AU-06 audit review; PM-06 performance; CA-07 continuous monitoring.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 includes specific compliance checking methodology. SP 800-53 assessment approach differs.

clauses.title: Documented operating procedures - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PL-02 system security plan; SA-05 documentation; CM family operational procedures.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 requires documented procedures for operational activities affecting security. SP 800-53 distributes this across families.

clauses.title: Screening - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PS-03 covers personnel screening with enhancements for citizenship and formal agreements.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Terms and conditions of employment - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PS-06 access agreements; PL-04 rules of behavior; PS-07 third-party personnel.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 details specific employment contract security clauses. SP 800-53 focuses on access agreements.

clauses.title: Awareness training - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AT family comprehensive for training implementation. PM-13 workforce; PM-14 testing/exercises.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Disciplinary process - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PS-08 covers personnel sanctions.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides detailed guidance on graduated disciplinary process. PS-08 is less prescriptive about process stages.

clauses.title: Post-employment responsibilities - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PS-04/PS-05 termination and transfer. PS-06 ongoing access agreements.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Confidentiality agreements - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PS-06 access agreements include confidentiality. SA-09 external service agreements.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 details NDA content requirements. SP 800-53 less specific about NDA clause requirements.

clauses.title: Remote working - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AC-17 remote access with multiple enhancements; PE-17 alternate work site; SC-28 protection at rest.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 includes physical security at remote location and clean desk for remote workers.

clauses.title: Event reporting - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IR-06 incident reporting; IR-07 assistance; IR-01 policy. Comprehensive event reporting implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Physical security perimeters - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PE-03 physical access control with enhancements. PE-04 transmission medium protection.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Physical entry - Implementation
clauses.rationale: Comprehensive physical entry controls with visitor management, monitoring, and logging.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Securing offices and rooms - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PE-03 access control; PE-05 output device access; PE-18 component location.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 addresses office-specific risks (sound insulation, door locks, window protection).

clauses.title: Physical security monitoring - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PE-06 monitoring physical access with alarm enhancements.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Environmental protection - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PE family comprehensive for environmental controls implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Working in secure areas - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PE controls cover access. PE-07 visitor escort.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 implementation guidance includes photography restrictions, supervised access, and empty area procedures.

clauses.title: Clear desk and clear screen - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AC-11 session lock; MP-04 media storage; PE-05 output devices.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 provides detailed clean desk implementation. SP 800-53 addresses screen lock but desk procedures less specific.

clauses.title: Equipment siting - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PE-14 environmental controls; PE-18 location of components.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 details equipment placement (viewing angles, access, environmental). SP 800-53 less specific.

clauses.title: Off-premises security - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AC-17 remote access; MP-05 media transport; SC-28 protection at rest; AC-19 mobile devices.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 covers all off-premises assets including physical protection guidance.

clauses.title: Storage media - Implementation
clauses.rationale: MP family comprehensive for media lifecycle implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Supporting utilities - Implementation
clauses.rationale: Comprehensive supporting utility implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Cabling security - Implementation
clauses.rationale: PE-04 transmission medium access control; PE-09 power cabling protection.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides specific cabling implementation (shielding, separate power/telecom, inspection). SP 800-53 less detailed.

clauses.title: Equipment maintenance - Implementation
clauses.rationale: MA family comprehensive for maintenance implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Secure disposal - Implementation
clauses.rationale: MP-06 media sanitization with enhanced methods (purge, destroy).
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 includes equipment disposal. MP-06 focuses on media.

clauses.title: User endpoint devices - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AC-19 mobile device management; CM-07 least functionality; SC-28 encryption at rest; CM-08 inventory.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides holistic endpoint management guidance (BYOD, MDM, containerization). SP 800-53 distributes across controls.

clauses.title: Privileged access - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AC-06 least privilege with enhancements; AC-02 account management; AC-05 separation of duties; IA-02(1) MFA for privileged.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Information access restriction - Implementation
clauses.rationale: Comprehensive access restriction implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Source code access - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CM-05 access restrictions for change; SA-10 developer configuration management.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 specifically addresses source code repositories and libraries. SP 800-53 addresses generally.

clauses.title: Secure authentication - Implementation
clauses.rationale: IA family comprehensive for authentication implementation including MFA.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Capacity management - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AU-04 audit storage capacity; SC-05 DoS protection; CP-02 capacity planning.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 addresses proactive capacity management for all resources. SP 800-53 covers specific capacity contexts but lacks general IT capacity management control.

clauses.title: Malware protection - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SI-03 malicious code protection with comprehensive enhancements. SI-08 spam protection.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Technical vulnerability management - Implementation
clauses.rationale: RA-05 vulnerability scanning with enhancements; SI-02 flaw remediation; SI-05 security alerts.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Configuration management - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CM family comprehensive for configuration management implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Information deletion - Implementation
clauses.rationale: MP-06 media sanitization; SI-12 information management.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 addresses deletion based on retention requirements. SP 800-53 focuses on sanitization methods.

clauses.title: Data masking - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SI-19 de-identification; PT-06/PT-07 privacy processing.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 provides specific masking technique guidance (pseudonymization, anonymization, masking rules). SP 800-53 less prescriptive on masking implementation.

clauses.title: Data leakage prevention - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AC-04 information flow; PE-19 information leakage; SC-07 boundary protection; SI-04 monitoring.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 specifically addresses DLP tool implementation. SP 800-53 distributes DLP concepts across controls.

clauses.title: Information backup - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CP-09 system backup with integrity testing enhancement. CP-06 alternate storage.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Redundancy - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CP family alternate site/processing/telecom. SC-36 distributed processing.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Logging - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AU family comprehensive for logging implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Monitoring activities - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SI-04 with enhancements provides comprehensive monitoring implementation. CA-07 continuous monitoring.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Clock synchronization - Implementation
clauses.rationale: AU-08 with synchronization with authoritative source enhancement.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Privileged utility programs - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality; CM-11 software installation; AC-06 least privilege.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 specifically addresses privileged utilities. SP 800-53 addresses through general controls.

clauses.title: Software installation - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CM-05 access restrictions for change; CM-11 user-installed software; SA-22 unsupported components.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Networks security - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection with enhancements. Comprehensive network security implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Network services security - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SC-07/SC-08 network protection; SA-09 external service agreements.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 requires specific SLA terms for network services.

clauses.title: Network segregation - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SC-07 with segmentation; SC-32 system partitioning. Comprehensive network segregation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Web filtering - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection; SI-03 malware protection; AC-04 information flow.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 specifically addresses URL filtering/web content filtering. No dedicated SP 800-53 web filtering control.

clauses.title: Cryptography - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SC-12 key management; SC-13 cryptographic protection; SC-28 data at rest; SC-08(1) transmission encryption.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Secure development life cycle - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA family comprehensive for SDLC implementation.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Application security requirements - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-04 requirements; SA-08 security engineering; SA-11 testing.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Secure architecture - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-08/SA-17 security architecture; PL-08 security architecture; SC-07/SC-32 architecture controls.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Secure coding - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-11 developer testing; SA-15 development standards; SA-16 training.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 provides specific secure coding practice guidance.

clauses.title: Security testing - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-11 with enhancements for static/dynamic analysis. CA-02 security assessments.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Outsourced development - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-04 with property rights enhancement; SA-09 external services; SA-10/SA-11 developer requirements.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 details outsourced development oversight. SP 800-53 covers through general acquisition.

clauses.title: Environment separation - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CM-04 impact analysis (test environments); SC-32 system partitioning; CM-02 baseline with variants.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ISO 27002 explicitly requires dev/test/prod separation. SP 800-53 implies but doesn't mandate.

clauses.title: Change management - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CM family comprehensive for change management implementation with enhancements.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Test information - Implementation
clauses.rationale: SA-11 testing; SA-15 development standards.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 details test data protection (anonymization, controlled production data use). SP 800-53 lacks explicit test data management.

clauses.title: Audit testing protection - Implementation
clauses.rationale: CA-02 security assessments; AU-06 audit review.
clauses.gaps: ISO 27002 requires minimizing audit disruption and protecting audit tools. Less explicit in SP 800-53.
